headline: Paprika Chicken with Chickpeas
description: One pot easy baked chicken thighs with smoked paprika, onions, and chickpeas!
name: Paprika Chicken with Chickpeas
keywords: 1-Pot, Budget, Pantry Meal, American, Gluten-Free, Dinner
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds chicken thighs (we used bone-in, skin-on), trimmed of excess fat
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro or parsley

recipeInstructions.text: Coat chicken with spices: Stir together the smoked paprika, salt, garlic powder, pepper, and ground oregano in a large bowl. Place the chicken thighs in the bowl and toss to coat completely with the spices. You can do this several hours ahead, or right before cooking. Your choice. The longer the chicken sits in the rub, the more the flavors will permeate.

Layer a casserole dish with sliced onions: Place the thinly sliced onions in the bottom of a casserole dish large enough to hold the chicken pieces with room in between. Toss with about 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and spread out in an even layer at the bottom of the dish.

Add chickpeas, lemon, oil to chicken: Add drained chickpeas, lemon zest, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil (2 Tbsp minus 1 teaspoon) to the bowl with the chicken and spices. Toss to coat the chicken evenly with the lemon and oil, and make sure that the chickpeas are coated with the spice mixture as well.
Arrange chicken and chickpeas over onion slices: Arrange chicken pieces, skin-side up, on top of the sliced onions in the casserole dish. Arrange the chickpeas between the chicken pieces.

Bake: Bake uncovered at 350°F for 40-45 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken thighs is at least 165°F when tested with a meat thermometer , and the top is lightly browned. Sprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro or parsley. Add more salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a side salad.

review.reviewBody:
I make this on the regular, it’s soooo good. 

A few tips to make it healthier and easier:
- use boneless skinless chicken thighs
- put sliced onion in the dish, add 2 cans of chick peas, squeeze lemon over, and then just press the seasoning into the chicken on both sides and lay on top. 
- cook at 400 for 20-25mins
This results in very flavorful chicken with more of a dry rub and the spices permeate down to the chickpeas and onion. I usually do about 3lbs of chicken and split it into two pans with the full onion and two cans of chick peas in each! I eat with roasted Brussels sprouts that I cook at the same time. So easy and so delicious with plenty left for meal prep!

I have to credit the author of this page. I had some chicken thighs and a tin of chickpeas to cook a meal and by chance, I had nearly all the ingredients required. Oven temperature and cooking time we’re both spot-on and the dish was delicious!
Terrific - the smoked paprika was awesome. A dash of lemon after plating brightened the chicken a little more. This will be a regular.
Made it exactly as specified and it was CRAZY GOOD. Very easy to put together and tastes gourmet. Happy I finally gave this a try!

Hi, I love this, I made everything In a pan. I sauté the chicken with olive oil, once the chicken was brown I added the onions until they browned then added the chickpeas and lemon and about half a cup of chicken stock. I cooked it covered for 30 minutes.
